# recommendedFraming

**Instance Property**

The latest recommended framing from the monitor.

## Declaration

```swift
var recommendedFraming: AVCaptureFraming? { get }
```

## Discussion

While your [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureSession] is running, the monitor continuously observes its device’s scene to recommend the best framing. This recommended framing is always one of the values in [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureSmartFramingMonitor/enabledFramings]. This property may return `nil` if smart framing isn’t supported for the device in its current configuration. Its default value is `nil`. This property is key-value observable, and when you observe a change, you may respond to the new recommendation by calling [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/setDynamicAspectRatio(_:completionHandler:)] and setting [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/videoZoomFactor] on the associated device in whatever order best matches your animation between old and new framings.

## Configuring framings

- **supportedFramings**: An array of framings supported by the monitor in its current configuration.
- **enabledFramings**: An array of framings that the monitor is allowed to suggest.
